New Records: Quinton de Kock's record knock of 174 and Heinrich Klaasen's 90 off 49 balls highlighted South Africa's formidable batting strength
De Kock surpassed India's Virat Kohli for the most runs and also surpassed Australia's David Warner (163) for the highest individual score in this World Cup
Key Match Events: South Africa posted a mammoth total of 382 for 5 in the group stage match
Bangladesh bowled out for a meager 145 in only 32 overs
Mahmudullah played a remarkable innings, scoring a century and forming crucial partnerships to reduce the margin of defeat
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa leapfrogged New Zealand to jump to the second spot behind India in the World Cup 2023 points table
Bangladesh suffered their third-largest defeat in World Cup history
De Kock exhibited remarkable hand speed and agile footwork after a somewhat slow start, unleashing a series of breathtaking shots across the field
Others: The match was played at Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium, and the conditions were hot and humid
